sections.title: Overview of FTC Motor Types
sections.content: FTC robots use a variety of DC motors, each with different capabilities. Choosing the right motor for your robot is important for performance and reliability.

sections.title: Common FTC Motors
sections.content:
Some common FTC motors include:
  • REV HD Hex Motor
  • AndyMark NeveRest
  • Tetrix Motor
  • GoBilda Yellow Jacket Motor
Each motor has different speed, torque, and encoder options.

sections.title: Choosing the Right Motor
sections.content:
Consider the following when choosing a motor:
  • Torque: Needed for lifting or pushing heavy objects.
  • Speed: Needed for fast movement.
  • Size and weight: Must fit your robot design.

sections.title: Reading Motor Specifications
sections.content: Always check the motor's datasheet for voltage, current, speed, and torque ratings. This helps you avoid damaging your hardware and ensures your robot performs as expected.

sections.title: Programming Differences
sections.content: Most FTC DC motors are programmed the same way. However, some may require different initialization when configuring the motor in the Driver Station or different settings. Always check the manufacturer's documentation.

sections.title: Practice: Compare Motor Specs
sections.description: Find the datasheets for two different FTC-legal motors. List their speed, torque, and encoder options. Discuss which would be better for a drivetrain versus an arm.
